title: Manager of Home Care Department
description:
**Manager of Home Care Department**

**Queens, NY**

**Hybrid- in office 1-2x a week**

**125k+**

Reputable home care agency is seeking a dedicated and experienced Manager to lead our Home Care Department. This role involves overseeing the daily operations, ensuring high-quality care, managing staff, and maintaining regulatory compliance. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, a background in healthcare, and a commitment to excellence in patient care. If you are a skilled and passionate leader with a background in home care management, this may be a perfect opportunity.

Key Responsibilities

* Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Home Care Department.
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations and standards.
* Develop and implement policies and procedures to enhance the quality and efficiency of home care services.
* Manage and support a team of home care staff, including recruitment, training, and performance evaluation.
* Coordinate with other departments to ensure seamless delivery of care services.
* Monitor patient care plans and ensure they are executed effectively.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date records and documentation.
* Address and resolve any issues or concerns from patients, families, and staff.
* Foster a positive and collaborative work environment.

Requirements

* Proven experience in a management role (5+ yrs preferred) within a home care or health care setting.
* Comprehensive knowledge of home care regulations and best practices.
* Strong organizational and leadership skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficiency in relevant software and technology used in home care management.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Lake Success, NY 11042: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Lake Success, NY 11042

title: Recreational Therapy Coordinator Part Time
description:
Job Title: Recreational Therapy Coordinator

Company: Westfield Senior Citizens Housing Corporation

Company Description: Affordable housing for seniors.

Job Summary:  
Westfield Senior Citizens Housing Corporation is seeking a passionate Recreation Coordinator to join our team. As a Recreation Coordinator, you will be responsible for planning and implementing recreational activities for our senior residents. You will play a vital role in enhancing the quality of life and well-being of our residents through engaging and stimulating programs.

Responsibilities:  
- Develop and organize recreational programs suitable for senior residents, including but not limited to yoga classes, dance therapy sessions, group therapy activities, and special education workshops.  
- Coordinate and lead recreational activities such as dance classes, group exercises, and arts and crafts sessions.  
- Work closely with residents with various needs, including those with autism, pediatrics, or individuals requiring special attention.  
- Maintain accurate medical records related to residents' participation in recreational activities.  
- Collaborate with healthcare professionals to incorporate medical terminology and care requirements into recreational programs.

Skills:  
- Proficiency in organizing and leading recreational activities.  
- Knowledge of medical terminology and experience working with seniors in a healthcare setting.  
- Familiarity with yoga, dance, group therapy, and special education practices.  
- Ability to work effectively with individuals with autism or other special needs.  
- Strong communication skills to interact compassionately with senior residents.  
- Experience in pediatric care or related fields is a plus.

If you are a dedicated individual with a passion for enhancing the lives of seniors through engaging recreational programs, we invite you to apply for the Recreation Coordinator position at Westfield Senior Citizens Housing Corporation. Join us in making a positive impact on the well-being of our senior community.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $24.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift
* No weekends

* Westfield, NJ (Required)

title: Leasing Agent
description:
**About us**

**At Living Residential , we are known as the “stone of successful love” It brings loyalty and provides for domestic bliss. It enhances unconditional love, unity and promotes friendship.**

**We're driven by a bold purpose: To make your living our life. We create value by building trust.**

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

* Performs all sales and leasing activities to achieve the community’s revenue and occupancy goals by greeting and qualifying prospective residents, conducting community tours and showing apartment homes, processing applications, credit screening, and criminal background checks, preparing the lease and move-in package, and ensuring a smooth resident move-in and lease signing.
* Maintain awareness of local market conditions and trends. Assists in developing and implementing short and long-term marketing plans and goals to sustain occupancy, and follows the community’s established policies related to concessions, specials, and other programs to boost occupancy.
* Answer incoming phone calls and handle each call accordingly, whether it is a client call, current resident, service request, etc. Transfer calls to Community Manager when appropriate.
* Uses the on-site community management software applications (Yardi, CRM, Rent Cafe) to track apartment home availability, record traffic and leasing activities, manage resident and future resident’s data, and capture critical demographic and other information about existing and future residents.
* Ensures that the community meets company standards by daily inspecting the corridors and leasing tour, communicating maintenance and upkeep needs to the community’s maintenance team, merchandising and ensuring physically appealing models and amenities, and preparing the leasing office for daily leasing activities.
* Follows-up with future guests and new residents to ensure satisfaction by sending e-mail, thank-you notes, and cards or making telephone calls or other contacts to finalize decisions to lease and/or renew.
* Executes activities in support of the community’s lease renewal program by preparing lease renewal letters and packages for residents, meeting with and contacting renewing residents in advance of move-out dates and ensuring that lease renewal documents are signed and implemented on time. Actively coordinate all renewals throughout the month. This includes sending letter, (90,60,30 days) and scheduling resident appointments to discuss renewal rates and leasing options.
* Responds quickly and courteously to resident concerns and questions and takes prompt action to solve problems and/or document and convey resident or other requests to the appropriate individual.
* Completes various accounting, financial, administrative reports.
* Identifies areas for improvement and offers suggestions and recommendations to improve efficiency and productivity.
* Assist with organizing resident events.
* Ability to keep sensitive information highly confidential at all times.
* Perform any additional duties assigned by Community Manager.
* QUALIFICATIONS **Computer Skills**:
* Be proficient with Yardi system as it pertains to all leasing and move-in/move-out activity
* ***Word/Excel***
* Be willing to learn new applications as may be required or updated
* Must be familiar with Yardi, CRM software

**Required Qualifications:**

As we review candidates for this role, we will be looking for these qualifications:

* Familiar with Yardi software.
* Detail Oriented and be able to follow through.
* Customer service skills.

Work Remotely

* No

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 - $23.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Driver's License (Required)

title: Crew Leader
company: Blue Kangaroo Packoutz of Long Island
description:
Blue Kangaroo Packoutz is the fastest growing provider of contents restoration in the country. We help people recover from fires, water damage, and natural disasters, by packing, cleaning, and storing personal property until their homes or businesses are ready to move back in.

At Blue Kangaroo Packoutz (BKP) of Long Island, we believe that contents restoration is more than just a job. It is about helping people through some of the most difficult moments of their lives. We are on a mission to make it as easy as possible for people to get their lives back in order after they have experienced a traumatic disruption to their home or business.

Job Summary:

The Lead Technician will supervise the cleaning and packout crews both in the field and in the warehouse. They will communicate the scope of the project to the team and make sure the necessary materials and equipment are available to get the job done.

Responsibilities:

* Ensure that inventory software is properly utilized for tracking the transfer and storage of all contents
* On-site point of contact for the customer (policy holder)
* Capturing an accurate inventory of contents
* Properly documenting all aspects of the packout
* Ensuring contents, including furniture, valuable and delicate items, are properly protected, labeled, and inventoried for transfer to warehouse
* Oversee contents cleaning, deodorizing, drying, and restoration at the warehouse
* Ensure proper tracking and storing of contents in vaults
* Work with the project manager to assist with computer work as needed
* Track usage of packing and cleaning supplies and ensure a proper inventory is maintained
* Ensure that all work is completed in accordance the schedule and with company standards

Qualifications:

* A desire to serve your community and be a team player
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* A willingness to work in challenging conditions (like in a home that has had a fire)
* Valid driver's license
* Are caring, patient, and compassionate. Have a genuine desire to make a difference in your client’s lives
* 2+ years of experience in restoration or moving industry is a plus

\\*

What you can expect from us:

* Opportunities for growth and development
* A positive and supportive work environment
* Competitive compensation
* A strong commitment to safety
* A willingness to listen and collaborate
* A commitment to diversity, inclusion, and a culture where all employees feel welcome and respected, regardless of their background

title: Medical Equipment Service and Delivery Driver (2nd Shift)- $21/hr
description:
**Who We Are**

Agiliti is a nationwide company of passionate medical equipment management experts who believe every interaction has the power to change a life. We proudly serve within hospitals, healthcare facilities, and our 90+ local service centers to ensure quality medical equipment is in the right place at the right time for effective patient care. Make an impact in healthcare and grow your career with Team Agiliti!

The **Medical Equipment Service and Delivery Driver** is responsible for driving to and from healthcare locations to complete delivery and equipment management tasks for a district office, including customer delivery and pick-up of medical equipment; processing, cleaning, inspecting, and testing equipment including inventory maintenance.

**Shift: Monday - Friday, 4pm - 12:30am** 

**What You Will Do in This Role**

* Safely load, secure, and deliver medical equipment to customers. Retrieves equipment from customer locations, safely transporting the equipment back to the office.
* Educate and engage customers at the time of delivery, keeping customers informed on the features and functionality of the equipment
* Complete all paperwork and data entry accurately and in a timely manner to ensure accurate documentation for billing, inventory, and regulatory compliance.

**What You Need For This Role**

* Be 21 years of age or older, with high school diploma or equivalent.
* Hold a current, valid, and unrestricted driver’s license. Must have a safe driving record based on Agiliti policies.
* Have customer service experience. Prior work experience in hospital setting is helpful.
* Have basic computer skills.
* Be willing to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays, as well as emergency off-hours as required to support a 24/7 schedule.
* Be able to lift and/or push up to 75 pounds.
* Be able to stand and walk for long periods of time.
* Be able to frequently bend, stoop, twist, climb, crouch/squat, kneel/crawl, sit, and stand for long periods of time.

title: Business Development Administrator
description:
**The Position**  
We at **Azend Pharma** are seeking a dynamic **Business Development Administrator** to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving business growth by developing and implementing strategic plans to expand the company's customer base.

**Duties**  
- Manage day-to-day administrative tasks, including scheduling, correspondence, and record-keeping.  
- Maintain accurate and organized documentation of contracts, agreements, and member information.  
- Coordinate meetings, prepare agendas, and take minutes for internal and external meetings.  
- Assist in the preparation and management of budgets, financial reports, and invoices.  
- Handle inquiries and provide support to member pharmacies regarding membership and administrative issues.

**Qualifications**  
- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.

- **EXCEL KNOWLEDGE IS A MUST**  
- Proven experience in administrative roles with a focus on business development or sales.  
- Excellent organizational and multitasking skills with attention to detail.  
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships.  
- Proficiency in **Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)** and familiarity with CRM software.  
- Knowledge of the pharmacy industry is highly desirable.

**Business Development**  
- Identify and research potential new pharmacies to join the buying group.  
- Develop and implement strategic plans to attract and recruit new member pharmacies.  
- Establish and maintain strong relationships with prospective and existing member pharmacies.  
- Conduct market analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive activities.  
- Prepare and deliver presentations to potential members, highlighting the benefits and value of joining the buying group.

**Communication and Collaboration**  
- Liaise with internal teams to ensure seamless integration and onboarding of new member pharmacies.  
- Collaborate with marketing to develop promotional materials and campaigns to attract new members.  
- Provide regular updates and reports to senior management on business development activities and progress.

**Personal Attributes**  
- Self-motivated and proactive with a results-oriented mindset.  
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  
- Strong problem-solving skills and adaptability to changing environments.  
- High level of integrity and professionalism.

**Working Conditions**  
- Full-time position with a standard workweek.  
- Some travel may be required to meet with prospective members and attend industry events.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our buying group while ensuring efficient and effective administrative operations. The role is an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual looking to make a significant impact on our company's growth. If you possess the required qualifications and are passionate about driving business success, we would love to hear from you.

title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
description:
Come make a difference with us!

**Registered Behavior Technician / Full Time Position**

Salary Starting From $41,000 / Salary adjustment based on experience

Here at the Gramon Family of Schools we aspire to help students with special needs achieve success in areas related to independence, life skill development and academics. Drawing on the principles of applied behavioral analysis and the collaboration of professionals in all disciplines such as occupational and physical therapy, speech language services, counseling services, we strive to make an impact not only on our students’ educational goals but also on their lives beyond our classrooms.

Our teams are supportive, caring, and willing to go the extra mile to ensure success! Our working environment supports a culture that involves team building, mentoring, shared success, and fun!

**The primary responsibilities of the Registered Behavior Technician is to assist** in crisis response and in training support staff on crisis management. Support behavior plans by assisting with data collection and the collection of IOA data. Assist behaviorists with facilitation of Functional Behavioral Assessments and pair with new instructional paraprofessionals upon hire to assist in the proper training. Assist behaviorists and classrooms in materials needed to implement behavior intervention plans and conduct training related to Safety Care.

Regular School Year (September – June) staff hours Monday - Friday from 8:00 am - 3:30 pm.

Summer hours are from 8:30 am – 3:00 pm for 30 days in July – 2nd week in August

**Job Requirements**:

* High School diploma; 60 credits preferred. Registered Behavior Technician Certification
* Experience working with students with autism and experience in ABA preferred
* Ability to communicate effectively
* Ability to work in a changing and challenging environment

**Features/Salary/Benefits**:

* Positive working environment
* Salary increased for college credit/college degree/substitute teach certification and/or NJ Teacher Certification
* Health benefits plan
* Employer paid Flexible Spending Account
* Retirement Plan
* Option for waiver of health benefits payment
* Referral Incentives
* Attendance Incentives
* Tuition Assistance

**Highly competitive benefits and compensation**

**Equal Employment Opportunity Employer/Minorities are encouraged to apply**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $41,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Logistic Specialist
description:
**Logistics Specialist** 

**JOB OVERVIEW**

The Key Objective of the Logistic Specialist is to contribute to the growth and profitability of Multi-Pak by effectively by supporting the Logistics Manager in managing the shipments out to customers. Specifically, under the general direction of the Logistic Manager, he/she is responsible and has commensurate authority for the following:

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* **Coordinating and Planning**
* Support the coordination, planning, execution, and monitoring of logistic operations.
* Organize all finished goods from the Clinton production/warehouse at Chapin by PO and Lot numbers.
* Provide a daily tracker of all finished goods in the warehouse.
* **Shipping and Receiving**:
* Ensure all outgoing and incoming shipments are accurate and undamaged.
* Responsible for managing all shipment documents (such as BOL, invoices, and packing lists) with the truck drivers.
* Maintain an inventory of shipping supplies.
* **Customer Interaction**:
* When necessary, support the Logistics Manager by providing customers with order confirmations.
* Confirm appointments for all shipments in and out of the warehouse and hold drivers to the schedule.
* **Incoming and Outgoing Materials**:
* Process outbound shipments, including order confirmation and physical checks of outgoing materials.
* Ensure a double check of the number of pallets on the outgoing truck occurs.
* In support of warehouse personnel, at times the job will require receiving incoming shipments. Follow established procedures and compare received items with the shipment order, ensure material quality, and stock them in the warehouse.

· All other duties as assigned by supervisor or manager.

**QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:**

· A collaborative and positive attitude is required. A desire to learn is exhibited.

· A high school graduate with experience in shipping, receiving and inventory management for a manufacturing company.

· Bi-lingual is a plus (English-Spanish).

· Proficiency in math and basic computer skills (e.g. Microsoft Word, Excel)

· Previous certification demonstrating ability to drive a forklift.

**REPORTING RELATIONSHIP:**

* Manager: Logistics Manager
* Managerial Responsibility: N/A

**PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS:**

· Must be able to lift-up to 45 pounds frequently and 75 pounds on occasion.

· Must be able to push manual pallet jacks over 100 pounds.

· Must be able to walk or stand up to 90% of the time.

· The person in this position is sometimes required to function in narrow aisles or passageways while walking throughout the warehouse area.

· The person in this position will need to occasionally kneel, climb, crawl, climb and/or reach to complete their job duties.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $24.00 per hour

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Pine Brook, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Power Diem Outreach Coordinator
description:
**About Us:**

Prospect Residence is a Class C boarding home dedicated to providing compassionate care and support to mentally disabled or elderly individuals needing assistance. Our services include primary living accommodations, laundry, nutritious meals, and comprehensive care. We strive to create a warm and welcoming environment for all our residents.

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic Peer Outreach Coordinator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with referral sources, including hospitals, daycare programs, nursing homes, psychiatric inpatient facilities, shelters, and other relevant organizations. The goal is to increase awareness of our services and bring in new referrals to our boarding homes and group homes.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Develop and implement outreach strategies to engage potential referral sources.
* Visit hospitals, daycare programs, nursing homes, psychiatric inpatient facilities, shelters, and other relevant organizations to promote our services.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders and referral sources.
* Organize and participate in community events, health fairs, and other outreach activities.
* Provide information and education about our services to potential referral sources and the community.

title: Sales Development Representative (f/d/m)
description:
#### **THE ROLE**


Businesses must decarbonize their operations to achieve real climate progress. Some emissions are unavoidable, and that’s where CEEZER comes in.


CEEZER is a platform for CO2 compensation and high-tech removal credits with access to >8,000 climate projects worldwide, verified by globally recognized registries. Transactions take place between corporations and project developers at the source, without any middlemen or hidden fees. CEEZER achieves this by providing scientific quality and pricing insights that help buyers and sellers interact, while allowing them to monitor credits in a balanced, high-quality portfolio.


We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Development Representative (f/d/m) to join our team. You’ll work closely with our Sales team & SVP Business Development in a collaborative, fast-moving, VC-funded startup.

#### **YOUR TASKS**


You will be at the forefront of our Go-To-Market (GTM) operations, working closely with the sales team to identify and qualify potential customers. You will accomplish this by:

* Conducting market research to identify target companies
* Launching high-impact, customized campaigns that initiate meaningful conversations
* Engaging with prospects to understand their needs and desires
* Strategically devising plans to conquer the remaining market
* Providing regular reports on sales activities and results to management
* Using customer relationship management (CRM) software to manage leads and sales activities

#### **WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED**

* 2+ years of Professional work experience
* Consistently organized and able to meet weekly campaign and prospecting objectives
* Exceptional oral and written communication skills
* Highly proficient in Excel and PowerPoint
* Are well-versed in standard prospecting tools
* Continuously expand your knowledge of new industries, technologies, and strategies, especially in the area of sustainability and the carbon market
* Thrive in a fast-paced environment and quickly adaptable to changing priorities
* Eager to learn with a winning outlook and desire to grow professionally
* Experience in or a strong desire to work in Sustainability/Climate
* Ready to jump in and be part of a fun team!
* Are based in/near New York City


Nice to have:  

* Experience in the Voluntary Carbon Market

#### **WHY CEEZER**

* Make a positive impact on the world and work on a mission that matters
* A rapidly growing international team of talented and highly committed people who are significantly contributing to the net zero transition
* Strong learning and development culture in a VC-backed, early-stage startup
* Competitive salary
* Generous paid vacation plus holidays
* Team Offsites
* CEEZER is a carbon positive company that will neutralize your footprint from day 1
* A truly inclusive environment - diversity is in our DNA and we flourish as a team of different races, genders, sexual orientations, and identities


Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with the final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $80k OTE ($50k-60k base) annually for New York City.#### **About us**


Businesses must decarbonize their operations to achieve real climate progress. Some emissions are unavoidable, and that’s where CEEZER comes in.
CEEZER is a platform for CO2 compensation and high-tech removal credits with access to >8.000 climate projects worldwide, verified by globally recognized registries. Transactions take place between corporations and project developers at the source, without any middlemen or hidden fees. CEEZER achieves this by providing scientific quality and pricing insights that help buyers and sellers interact while allowing them to monitor credits in a balanced, high-quality portfolio.

title: Confirmatory Typing Coordinator
description:
**Position Summary:** The Confirmatory Typing (CT) Coordinator works in the Confirmatory Typing Team with unrelated donors at the initial stage of the donor and patient matching process. The CT Coordinator facilitates registry and transplant center requests for registered donors to participate in high resolution and confirmatory testing.

**Responsibilities:**

* Contact donors identified as potential matches for patients in need of a bone marrow transplant to assess donor interest and availability
* Educate donors on the marrow and peripheral blood stem cell donation process
* Evaluate donors for medical suitability and eligibility using guidelines set by DKMS and the National Marrow Donor Program (NMDP)
* Obtain informed donor consent for blood tests
* Facilitate high resolution and confirmatory testing through the coordination of laboratory appointments nationwide
* Meet donor availability and scheduling metric goals consistently
* Comply with all regulatory requirements, standards, policies, procedures pertaining to the donor management process including: principles of informed consent and Protection of Humans as Research Subjects; bone marrow donor registry requirements and standards, applicable FDA and NY State Department of Health regulatory requirements (including, but not limited to FDA Good Tissue Practices and Good Manufacturing Practices; NY DOH tissue procurement)
* Adheres to quality assurance procedures to ensure donor and patient confidentiality
* Assists in creation and maintenance of departmental Standard Operating Procedures per required regulations
* Assists in investigation of Quality Assurance incidents and occurrences.
* Ad hoc activities including research, quality assurance, and process improvement projects. Additional duties may be assigned. Management retains the discretion to add to or change the duties of the position at any time.
* Flexibility to work remotely outside of core business hours (weekends) for donor outreach as needed by the department.
* Occasional travel may be necessary

Requirements/Qualifications:

Because the candidate will be working with potential donors on a daily basis, it is essential to have excellent communication and active listening skills. The ideal candidate must be highly organized and detail oriented. Accuracy in completing data forms and case note documentation is essential.

· Bachelor’s degree required

· Minimum of two years related work experience to include customer service or patient care; or equivalent combination of education and experience

· Be able to work from 8:30am-5pm Monday to Friday/1pm – 9pm Monday to Friday. 10am – 2pm Saturdays. Sundays as needed.

· Knowledge of medical terminology, case-note documentation, and conducting medical histories is preferred

· Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team environment

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Very proactive work ethic and the ability to diligently meet targets

· Must be detailed oriented, highly organized and able to multitask efficiently

· Flexible, entrepreneurial spirit

· Proficiency in Windows and/or Mac OS, Word, Outlook, Excel, and internet searches required; experience with NMDP StarLink systems a plus; foreign language desirable

Pay: $44,000.00 - $48,000.00 per year

title: Travel-Cat Scan Tech
description:
***Job Title: Travel-****Cat Scan Tech*

***Location:*** *Summit, NJ 07901*

***Payrate:*** *$70/hr*

***Job Description:*** 

* *Days per week: Thursday, Saturday, and Sunday*
* *Shift: 8am -8pm*
* *On-call or weekends required?*
* *Float IV Certified*
* *Call Back: as needed*

***Duties:***

***Job Function 1: Prepares Equipment and Supplies for Specific Procedures***

* *Demonstrates professionalism and service excellence while performing tasks.*
* *Obtains necessary medical, surgical, and radiological supplies for specific procedures according to established protocols.*
* *Maintains sterility of field and instruments.*
* *Correctly prepares requisitions.*

***Job Function 2: Ensures Patients' Physical and Psychological Comfort***

* *Communicates with the patient and family before, during, and after the procedure to alleviate anxiety while maintaining privacy and dignity.*
* *Adheres to HIPAA regulations and respects patient privacy.*
* *Verifies patient identification according to AHS policy.*
* *Observes patient’s condition before and after contrast injections and reports any sudden changes to the nursing staff and Radiologist.*
* *Ensures availability of medical records, previous reports, labs, and patient history.*
* *Initiates emergency response in case of complications.*

***Job Function 3: Maintains Specific Inventory Records and Ensures Area is Stocked with Adequate Supplies***

* *Maintains adequate linen supplies in each scanning room.*
* *Maintains adequate contrast media and biopsy/drainage supplies in each scanning room.*
* *Adheres to room assignments (CT 1, 2, and 3).*
* *Assists in maintaining CT storeroom and outside inventory.*
* *Participates in daily inventory and stocking of supplies.*
* *Notifies Lead of expired or soon-to-expire equipment or medications.*
* *Cleans and inventories supplies.*
* *Participates in the routine cleaning of the CT gantry, table, and peripheral equipment after each use.*

***Job Function 4: Coordinates Schedule of Daily Exams***

* *Performs tasks while displaying involvement in patient care, professionalism, and respect for staff and patients.*
* *Triages procedures according to the daily schedule when assigned as Point.*
* *Ensures timely coordination of all emergency and unscheduled procedure requests.*
* *Assigns staff to ensure efficient workflow while maintaining patient safety.*
* *Maintains workflow within the section to coordinate emergent and unscheduled procedure requests within the schedule.*
* *Communicates with all departments and floors regarding patient status.*
* *Ensures immediate patient transport post-procedure.*

***Job Function 5: Performs All Tasks as Required by Coordinator and Lead Staff***

* *Assists in performing routine procedures.*
* *Assesses patient ability to tolerate contrast.*
* *Screens for allergies/medication incompatibilities.*
* *Cleans CT Unit and room after each use.*
* *Maintains orderliness and cleanliness of working area.*
* *Notifies Coordinator or Lead of equipment malfunctions.*
* *Maintains QA/QC requirements for daily, monthly, and ACR specifications.*
* *Recognizes unusual conditions in equipment operation.*
* *Alerts appropriate personnel of equipment malfunctions.*
* *Adheres to venipuncture and power injector protocols.*

***Job Function 6: Additional Responsibilities***

* *For cases requiring immediate results such as Code Grey, Trauma, and Partial Trauma, images are acquired, processed, sent, and verified/completed in PACS/RIS system per established protocol (Immediately after acquisition for Code Grey).*
* *Notifies the radiologist as Code Grey images are sent and follows up with any processed data.*
* *All staff should notify the radiologist of any unusual findings to provide optimal patient care.*

***Skills:*** *CT registered; Maintains current certification/licensure as required for position. CPR mandatory*

***Education:*** *CT registered and CPR mandator*

***Thanks & Regards***  
***Iris Smith***   
***iris.smith@centstone.com***   
***(332)-456-5875***  
***www.centstone.com***

title: Medical Assistant
description:
Internal Medicine Practice is seeking to hire a Medical Assistant to perform clinical and daily administrative tasks at our facility. No experience necessary. Will train the right candidate.

Duties and Responsibilities include a combination of various administrative and clinical tasks:

\\* Escorting patients to exam rooms, preparing patients for examination by obtaining vital signs and recording medical history and reason for the patients visit.

\\* Maintaining exam rooms and ensuring supplies are stocked and properly set.

\\* Administering vaccinations/injections.

\\* Performing EKG(s) and in office laboratory tests such as fingersticks.

\\* Educating patients by providing medication information and instructions, answering patient questions and phone calls.

\\* Calling in prescriptions under the direction of providers.

\\* Scheduling new and follow up appointments.

\\* Facilitating Front Desk coverage, patient check-in and check-out, collecting

co pays.

\\* Performing other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Leasing Consultant - Perth Amboy
description:
Kaplan Companies is recruiting for a leasing consultant with prior leasing experience and a strong closing record to lease apartments and be a customer service representative at our apartment community located in Perth Anboy, NJ. The candidate must be well organized, self-motivated and adaptable to changing situations. Must possess ability to work as a team to reach occupancy and renewal goals. Must have good oral and written communication skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word required. Valid driver license required. Full-time position that requires weekends. 40 hour work week. Health benefits offered after 60 days of employment. Equal Opportunity Employer.

**LEASING CONSULTANT**

Specific Duties and Responsibilities

Reports to: Property Manager

General Duties:

* Lease apartments at highest effective rent possible while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction.
* Qualifying, determining needs preferences, and provide features and benefits to prospective residents.
* Have the ability to sell qualities of community over the phone and be able to obtain appointments for the prospective resident to visit the property.
* Follow all company training and leasing guidelines in the sales process.
* Maintain a courteous and helpful attitude to residents, potential residents and vendors.
* Respond to residents requests in a prompt and courteous manner.
* Understand and work within the guidelines of all federal and state laws regarding Fair Housing and multi-family housing; OSHA, Workers’ Compensation, and Federal Wage and Hour Act.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Answer incoming phone calls in a pleasant and courteous manner.
* Understand company policies and procedures and convey them to current and potential residents.
* Understanding of all related leasing documents and the ability to accurately complete them in a timely manner.
* Maintain accurate resident files and a well organized work space.
* Enter walk-in traffic, phone-call traffic, leases and related information into the ASMI system daily.
* Track and accurately record traffic sources for all phone calls and walk-in traffic.
* Qualify all potential residents by following qualification guidelines of our company.
* Process applications and forward to Property Manager for approval process within 24 hours.
* Assist new residents in the move-in process including but not limited to obtaining signature of all lease documents and move in inspection requirements.
* All move in units prior to scheduled move in to ensure there are no outstanding defects.
* Aid in resident retention programs through contribution and development of programs and resident functions.
* Market the community to local businesses, real estate companies and locators.
* Physically visit competitive properties on a monthly basis and report finding to the Property Manager and in the form of a Market Survey.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Coordinator, Human Resources
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description** **Role Summary:**


The HR Coordinator for Universal Studio Group (USG) East provides administrative support for a fun and fast-paced client group supported by the USG East Coast HR team. This position is responsible for interfacing and problem solving with a variety of business partners and providing HR administrative and transactional support to television productions in New York, Eastern Canada, and Atlanta. This position will report to the VP and Sr. Director, Human Resources and is a unique opportunity to gain visibility into different parts of the company and develop your HR experience at NBCUniversal.


This position is based out of the iconic 30 Rock, New York, and works general business hours Monday – Friday from 9am to 6pm, with occasional work in the evenings and/or weekends. Opportunity for overtime.

**Responsibilities:**

* Process SAP transactions for employee lifecycle data changes, including new hires/terminations, transfers, promotions, and timekeeping actions.
* Oversee the administrative process for all leave of absence transactions, including partnering with payroll to ensure accuracy of LOA pay (e.g. payroll removals).
* Serve as primary user for all HR systems (SAP, SmartRecruiters, etc.) and run reports, as assigned.
* Act as a first point of contact and respond to routine HR questions from client group including, but not limited to, benefits, payroll, vacation or redirect employees to appropriate internal Centers of Excellence.
* Assist in planning and execution of events, such as local employee engagement events, dining reservations, employee activities, and winter holiday party.
* Provide administrative support to USG HR team, including preparing presentations, ad hoc reports, scheduling meetings, conference room reservations and technology set-up.
* Complete all administrative aspects of new employee onboarding, including I-9 verifications, offer letters, employee badge requests, partnering with Talent Acquisition to post open jobs, and maintaining database of job descriptions for client group.
* Schedule exit interviews and assist with administration of separating employees.
* Complete Employment Verification Letters for client group, as requested.
* Review, track, and respond to assistive animal applications on television productions.
* Provide administrative support during HR investigations by note taking and uploading files to the case management system. Maintain the highest level of confidentiality.
* Ensure organizational charts are updated regularly.
* Partner with other departmental Coordinators to ensure physical setup is complete for all new employees including phones, workspaces and computers.
* Maintain and update all employee email distribution lists, as well as staff contact lists.
* Attend and participate in regular corporate HR meetings, as required.
* Keep apprised of new and updated regulations, company policies & procedures.
* Draft HR communications for distribution to business clients, as needed.
* Assist with support of HR executive’s calendar.
* Oversee HR department Page and assign tasks, as required.
* Ad hoc projects, as assigned.

  

**Qualifications** **Basic Requirements:**

* 1+ year of relevant work experience.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.
* Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.

**Come join us if you are****:**

* Able to maintain confidentiality and use discretion
* Strong in interpersonal & communication skills with an ability to interact with people at all levels
* Someone who demonstrates accountability, thinks critically, independently, and presents solutions
* A self-starter who takes initiative
* Resourceful and able to anticipate/see around corners
* Able to adapt quickly in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
* Have excellent organizational skills
* Process orientated, detail oriented, and have great follow through skills
* Can prioritize responsibilities
* Customer service orientated
* Interested in a career in HR

**Eligibility Requirements:**

* Interested candidates must apply to be considered
* Must be willing to work in New York, NY a minimum of 3 days/week
* Must be willing to work overtime when required
* Must be willing to travel for work related business if necessary
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
* Must be 18 years or older

**Additional Requirements:**


This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $50,000 - $65,000. This role has been designated as **hybrid**, generally contributing to the office a minimum of three days per week.

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

title: Food Service Worker
description:
***Location:****Financial Software Company - 29080002*

  

Working with Sodexo is more than a job; it’s a chance to be part of something greater. You’ll belong in a company and team that values you for you; you’ll act with purpose and have an impact through your everyday actions; and you’ll be able to thrive in your own way.

 **What We Offer:**

* Full array of benefits including paid time off, holidays, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401k and more may be available\\*
* Flexible and dynamic work environment
* Competitive compensation
* Access to ongoing training and development programs
* Countless opportunities to grow within the company
* Bonus Eligible: Varies by location

* Uniform Provided: Safety shoes and uniforms

However, due to the contractual nature of our business, some job duties and employee benefits may vary based on the unit where you are applying. Please ask your interviewer for additional location-specific information, such as your job duties and employee benefits offered at the unit, during the interview process.*

This role includes the preparation and serving of our vibrant cafe menuand ensuring all working areas are kept clean and tidy. Your welcoming customer service puts a smile on people's faces and makes an impact in their everyday lives. Join Sodexo and be part of something greater. You belong on a team where you can act with purpose and thrive in your own way.

  

The Food Service Worker may work anywhere on property where food is prepared or served. You will assist in setup and serving of food from counters and steamtables. Duties will include cleaning and sanitizing equipment and work stations. These responsibilities may differ among accounts, depending on business necessities and client requirements.  



  

Full Job Description


Benefit Summaries


Employment Type: Full-time


Min/Max Pay: $20 per hour - $21 per hour


**What You Bring:**

Strong teamwork and a positive attitude


Adaptability and willingness to learn


Passion for maintaining a healthy and safe environment

  

Sodexo is an EEO/AA/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

title: Cat Scan Tech
description:
***Job Title:*** *Cat Scan Tech*

***Location:*** *Morristown, NJ 07960*

***Payrate:*** *$70/hr*

***Job Description:*** 

* ***Days per week:*** *Monday – Friday*
* ***Shift:*** *3pm-11pm*
* ***On call or weekends required?***
* ***Float:*** *NO*
* ***Call Back:*** *YES*

***Duties:***

* ***Prepares Equipment and Supplies for Specific Procedures:***
* *Demonstrates professionalism and service excellence.*
* *Obtains and prepares necessary medical, surgical, and radiological supplies according to established protocols.*
* *Maintains sterility of field and instruments.*
* *Correctly prepares requisitions.*
* ***Ensures Patients’ Physical and Psychological Comfort:***
* *Communicates with the patient and family before, during, and after the procedure to alleviate anxiety while maintaining privacy and dignity.*
* *Adheres to HIPAA regulations and respects patient privacy.*
* *Verifies patient identification according to AHS policy.*
* *Observes and reports any sudden changes in patient’s condition to the nursing staff and Radiologist.*
* *Ensures availability of medical records, previous reports, labs, and history.*
* *Can initiate emergency response in case of complications.*
* ***Maintains Specific Inventory Records and Ensures Area is Stocked:***
* *Maintains adequate linen supplies and contrast media in scanning rooms.*
* *Assists in maintaining CT storeroom and participates in daily inventory and stocking of supplies.*
* *Notifies Lead of expired or soon-to-expire equipment or medications.*
* *Cleans and inventories supplies and participates in routine cleaning of the CT gantry and equipment.*
* ***Coordinates Schedule of Daily Exams:***
* *Triages procedures according to the daily schedule and ensures timely coordination of emergency and unscheduled procedure requests.*
* *Assigns staff to ensure efficient workflow and maintains patient safety.*
* *Communicates with all departments and floors regarding patient status.*
* *Ensures immediate patient transport post-procedure.*
* ***Performs All Tasks as Required by Coordinator and Lead Staff:***
* *Assists in routine procedures, assesses patient tolerance to contrast, screens for allergies/medication incompatibilities.*
* *Cleans CT Unit and room, maintains orderliness and cleanliness of the working area.*
* *Notifies Coordinator or Lead of equipment malfunctions and maintains QA/QC requirements.*
* ***Additional Responsibilities:***
* *For cases requiring immediate results (e.g., Code Grey, Trauma), acquires, processes, sends, and verifies/completes images in PACS/RIS system per established protocol.*
* *Notifies the radiologist of Code Grey images and any unusual findings to provide optimal patient care.*

***Skills:***

* *CT registered; maintains current certification/licensure as required.*
* *CPR mandatory.*

***Education:***

* *CT registered and CPR mandatory.*

***Thanks & Regards***  
***Iris Smith***   
***iris.smith@centstone.com***   
***(332)-456-5875***  
***www.centstone.com***

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70.00 per hour

Expected hours: 36 per week

Schedule:

* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

License/Certification:

* CPR Certification (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director of Talent
description:
The Director of Talent works directly with the United Charter High Schools (UCHS) leadership and staff to ensure the operational functions of the organization are efficient and in compliance with federal and state laws, directives and school board policy in a manner that will provide the overall success of staff and students. Under the guidance and supervision of the Chief Operations Officer, the Director of Talent will play a key role in supporting the talent and recruitment work of the charter schools as part of United Charter High Schools through research, innovative thought, program development and design, partnerships and compliance. The Director of Talent leads the implementation and maintenance of all personnel management, which enables a supportive school environment. The Director will therefore, be an individual who embraces innovation and continuous improvement, is willing to get his/her hands dirty, and relishes the challenge of finding ways to work smarter and cost-efficiently. As a member of the Chief Operations Officer’s senior team, the Director of Talent participates in the school’s overall strategy, planning, and delivery with talent. This position is based at the main office but requires some travel to local school sites as determined by the Chief Operations Officer and/or Chief Executive Officer.

**To apply, visit the United Charter High Schools careers site:**

**https://grnh.se/7ab62bb11us**

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

*Daily Operations*

* Support the initiatives and follow the directives of the Chief Operations Officer.
* Plan, develop and implement programs, activities and functions designed to achieve school and staffing goals.
* Attends meetings as directed by the COO or assigned designee.
* Manage and maintain positive relationships with staff and organization guests.
* Provide timely and concise communications to staff, families and community members.
* Review organization policy and regulations often to ensure compliance and best practices.
* Updates the organization’s employee handbook.
* Ensures timely submission of local, state and federal reporting.
* Extends top-notch customer service to employees and guests of the organization.
* Oversees the management of personnel records and processing.
* Completes projects and assignments as assigned promptly and accurately.
* Attends required department meetings and serves, as appropriate, on staff committees when requested.
* Is informed about school and organization activities, requirements of the law and code, Board policy and regulations, and other information necessary for the functioning of the office.
* Serves as a role model for students and staff in demonstrating positive attitudes, appropriate attire and grooming, accepting responsibility, and an effective work ethic.
* Assists in the planning and coordinating of employee-focused events.
* Is responsible for creating and revising structures and systems that will support and improve upon existing routines.
* Develops and implements organization recruiting programs and events.
* Develops and implements organization wellness events.
* Provide new employee orientation.
* Provide employee education on employment policies, expectations, protocols and best practices.
* Distributes employee materials and logins.
* Performs regular data entry.
* Composes letters and materials to disseminate to employees.
* Responds promptly to employee requests and inquiries.
* Processes Leaves of absence – short and long-term requests.
* Creates network-wide systems for substitute teaching resources.
* Manages organization benefits and enrollment.
* Ensures labor relations compliance pursuant to organization Policy state and federal laws.
* Develop and coordinate effective employee experience programs to foster the retainment of staff.
* Works with recruiting firms and colleges to promote the organization to recruit staff.
* Manages the organization’s recruiting, retention and exit strategies and plan.
* Conducts hiring interviews for various positions throughout the organization.
* Represents the organization in contract negotiations, meetings and labor hearings as needed.
* Review employee compensation and pay scales regularly to ensure compliance.
* Performs regular research to ensure competitive compensation, services, and overall experience.
* Uses surveys, interviews, and other studies to research human resource policies, compensation, and other employment issues. After analyzing the information, make recommendations on changes, adjustments or enhancements.
* Advises and trains leaders on best employee relations practices and strategies for managing concerns and employee grievances, including training on employment laws and legal affairs.
* Assists in the implementation and management of the organization’s employee wellness and recognition program.
* Processes verification requests.
* Assists with the organization’s employee mentoring program.
* Manages provisional teacher program.
* Designs job descriptions for new staff positions and coordinates the periodic review and revision of existing job descriptions.
* Distributes employment contracts and agreements.
* Maintains knowledge of all current negotiated employee contracts in force in the organization and alerts administrators, as appropriate, to any contradictions or problems arising out of the contracts with regard to the job description.
* Manages health benefits program.
* Prepares and presents reports as necessary.
* Prepares and presents upon request the department personnel record for Board of Trustee approval.
* Maintains an up-to-date application file of prospective candidates for all positions.
* Assists employees with obtaining proper credentialing.
* Maintains confidentiality and integrity.
* Exercises best practice and judgment.
* All work responsibilities are subject to having performance goals and/or targets established.

*School Culture*

* Builds a joyful and rigorous school culture.
* Promotes transparency and collaboration.
* Works with principals to develop and implement programs fostering workplace wellness and support for professional development.
* Partners with principals in fostering consistency in academic and behavioral expectations.
* Ensures that traditions and rituals that the United Charter High Schools mission, vision, and values are built and maintained, year after year.
* Recommends programs to address personnel concerns and maintain a positive morale amongst staff.
* Provides regular correspondence to employees regarding benefits and other pertinent information related to their employment.

*Management*

* Acts as a critical member of the school leadership team.

* Undertake special projects as needed.

* Hold and maintain a valid driver’s license with no serious violations (if applicable to assignment).

title: Medical Assistant
description:
The Medical Assistant will assist with patient care management. Working collaboratively with the Physician, they will perform routine clerical, secretarial and administrative work in answering telephones, providing customer assistance, data processing, computer data entry and other record keeping tasks related to patient intake and patient care. Providing excellent customer service, the Medical Assistant will support the flow of patients from the waiting area to exam rooms and perform preparatory work on patients.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

● **Patient Care**: Greeting and accompanying patients to the examination room. Assisting

Podiatrists in providing patient care by preparing treatment rooms, escorting patients to

examination rooms, and taking medical histories.

● **Clinical Support**: Help podiatrists with clinical procedures such as wound care, toenail

trimming, foot exams, and minor surgical procedures.

● **Diagnostic Support**: Perform basic diagnostic tests such as blood pressure monitoring

under the supervision of a podiatrist.

● **Administrative Tasks**: Schedule patient appointments, check-in/out patients, process

referrals and run insurance benefits check, manage medical records, and handle billing

and insurance claims. Be well versed in billing terminology including but not limited to

insurance coverage, prior authorizations and denials.

● **Patient Education:** Reinforce foot care techniques, treatment plans, and follow-up care

instructions to patients.

● **Instrument Sterilization**: Ensure that all instruments are properly sterilized and

maintained according to healthcare standards.

● **Inventory Management:** Maintain inventory of medical supplies and equipment, and

order supplies as needed. Manage dispensing of inventory including OTC, non-custom

and custom products.

● **Assistance in Specialized Procedures**: Assist with specialized procedures such as orthotic

fittings, casting, and biomechanical assessments.

● **Emergency Response:** Assist in responding to medical emergencies that may arise in the

practice.

● **Compliance and Regulation:** Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and

maintain patient confidentiality at all times.

**Qualifications:**

● High school diploma or equivalent.

● Completion of a medical assistant training program or relevant certification.

● Medical/Clinical experience preferred.

● EMR/Data entry knowledge.

● Front desk experience in a medical setting is preferred.

● Knowledge of medical terminology and basic clinical procedures.

● Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

● Ability to multitask and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.

● Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate medical records.

● Understanding of patient confidentiality laws and regulations.

title: Usher/Caterer
description:
**Job Title:** Usher/Caterer  
**Department:** Operation/Events  
**Reports To:** Events Operation Manager  
**Designation:** Hourly / Non-Exempt  
**Salary:** $19.00 / hour with a 4-hour shift minimum.  
---------------  
**Starting date:** August 2024

**Position Summary:** 

L’Alliance New York is seeking friendly and resourceful people to join its events team. Events range from simple screenings in L’Alliance New York’s 361-seat theater to multi-room conferences and catered receptions. Event staff ushers or caters, depending on events, and is the public face of L’Alliance New York for our audiences and rental clients. Kindness, professionalism, and a calm demeanor in a fast-paced environment are of utmost importance for our events staff.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Facilitate a friendly, comfortable, and safe atmosphere at L’Alliance New York events.
* Facilitate audience flow through an event (entry, seating, departure), including answering questions about L’Alliance New York policies (no eating in the theater, for example) and directing audiences to venues within L’Alliance New York’s building.
* Scanning tickets, seating folks when seats are assigned, and troubleshooting any seating complications that may occur.
* Catering, including passing hors d’oeuvres, bar tending, and bussing at receptions and dinners.
* Simple setup of facilities, including tables, chairs, stanchions, and signage.
* Simple cleaning of event department’s supplies, including the return of chairs and tables to their closets, pulling inside any signage or stanchions used on the sidewalk and leaving the kitchen clean after catered events.
* Stay in communication with head usher/caterer, as well as with the technical and maintenance departments should anything require their attention.
* Ensure that facilities are clean and clear should an emergency arise. This includes making sure that all aisles are clear, and all doorways are unobstructed.
* Problem-solving complaints and emergencies, including medical emergencies (calling 911, collecting information, etc.).
* Ensuring compliance with L’Alliance New York’s Covid Safety Protocols, including checking for proof of vaccination as needed.

Please note that the above is not an exhaustive list of duties and you will be expected to perform different tasks as necessitated by your role within the organization and the overall business objectives of L’Alliance New York.

**Requirements/Skills:**

* Advanced customer service skills.
* Excellent communication skills for conversing with clients, guests, and employees.
* Understanding of safe food handling policies and procedures.
* Problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
* Time management and organizational skills.

**Salary/Benefits :**

· Pay is $19.00 per hour with a 4-hour shift minimum.

· Excellent working environment

· L’alliance New York Membership

· Flexible schedule.

· Free group French Classes (after 3 months of employment)

· Reimbursed cab rides home for shifts that begin at 6 am and end after 11 pm.

**TO APPLY**

Please submit a cover letter and resume to Lunie Jules, Events Operations Manager, at ljules@lallianceny.org.

**PLEASE NOTE**: Due to the large number of applicants we receive, we will only be able to contact those that we would like to meet for interviews. No phone calls please.

*L'Alliance New York is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, marital status, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, citizenship status protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Registered Nurse - Part Time Nights 7pm - 7am
description:
**Summit Oaks Hospital,** a 126 bed, private acute care hospital and chemical dependency treatment center, located in a picturesque suburban setting, fully accredited (by the Joint Commission), has been providing quality health care to adult, child and adolescent northeastern USA residents, since 1902.Summit Oaks has repeatedly been recognized in U.S. News & World Report, as one of the nation's best behavioral health hospitals.

Much more online at: https://summitoakshospital.com/

This is a Part Time position from 7pm - 7am two days per week for 24 hours a week. There is opportunity to cover various shifts and pick up overtime if interested.

**Job Duties/Responsibilities**

* Assess and respond to medical needs of patients under the guidance of the physicians.
* Conduct safety checks and implement appropriate behavioral management techniques.
* Monitor, report, and document patient behaviors and overall well being.
* Administer medications and perform treatments as needed under the guidance of treatment team.
* Maintain the core values and mission of Summit Oaks Hospital.

**Benefits for our Registered Nurse (RN) include:**

* In-house Psychiatric Nurse Residency Transition-to-Practice Orientation (Could earn 20 CEUs)
* Career development opportunities across UHS and its 300+ locations!
* Diverse programming to expand your experience and energize your career
* HealthStream online learning catalogue with plenty of free CEU courses
* Competitive Compensation & Generous Paid Time Off
* Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plans
* 401(K) with company match and discounted stock plan

**About Universal Health Services**

One of the nation’s largest and most respected providers of hospital and healthcare services, Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) has built an impressive record of achievement and performance. Growing steadily since its inception into an esteemed Fortune 500 corporation, annual revenues were $14.3 billion in 2023. During the year, UHS was again recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune; and listed in Forbes ranking of America’s Largest Public Companies. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS has approximately 96,700 employees and continues to grow through its subsidiaries. Operating acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities, outpatient facilities and ambulatory care access points, an insurance offering, a physician network and various related services located all over the U.S. states, Washington, D.C., Puerto Rico and the United Kingdom. www.uhs.com

If you would like to learn more about the position before applying, please contact ***Matthew Selitto, Regional Recruiter at*** **matthew.selitto@uhsinc.com**

**Registered Nurse (RN) Job Requirements:**

* Current New Jersey RN licensure; BSN/BS preferred.
* Minimum requirements are one (1) year of psychiatric nursing experience, or two (2) years of medical/surgical experience with proven leadership, strong clinical skills, and high motivation.
* Graduate of NLN accredited program preferred.
* ANA Psychiatric and Mental Health Nursing certification preferred.
* CPR certification required.

**EEO Statement**

All UHS subsidiaries are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates. UHS subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and as such, openly support and fully commit to recruitment, selection, placement, promotion and compensation of individuals without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), genetic information, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

We believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success.

**Avoid and Report Recruitment Scams**

At UHS and all our subsidiaries, our Human Resources departments and recruiters are here to help prospective candidates by matching skill set and experience with the best possible career path at UHS

and our subsidiaries. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (e.g., Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. Our recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Hotmail, Gmail, Yahoo Mail, etc.

If you suspect a fraudulent job posting or job-related email mentioning UHS or its subsidiaries, we encourage you to report such concerns to appropriate law enforcement. We encourage you to refer to legitimate UHS and UHS subsidiary career websites to verify job opportunities and not rely on unsolicited calls from recruiters

title: Supportive Housing Case Manager/Supervisor
description:
It is the mission of Columba Services to provide respectful and effective services to the individuals residing in the three Single Room Occupancy residences sponsored by Columba Kavanagh House. It is understood that the persons residing in these facilities have suffered extraordinary hardship and have significant challenges to living empowered healthy and productive lives. Therefore, beyond the normal concern for an individual's rights and freedoms, the responsibilities described herein shall be performed with the upmost diligence and care towards the goal of facilitating their further growth and independence.

The Case Manager/ Supervisor shall have a Master's degree in a social services-related field and two years of experience. Some of the experience must have been in a Supervisory and administrative capacity with homeless, homeless mentally ill, or mentally ill adults. Qualified individuals must demonstrate the capacity for leadership and the ability to supervise others. The Supervisor reports to the Director of Residential Services.

The Supervisor shall be responsible for the following tasks. Direct supervision of services to tenants. This responsibility shall include and not be limited to the development and implementation of service plans, maintenance and acceptable health and safety standards in the facility, the behavior and performance of staff in carrying out tasks and services, and facilitation of program improvements wherever possible. Services shall include these delivered those delivered directly and those available by community providers.

Leading the weekly program meetings (staff and rounds). These shall include collaborative conferences with other providers, service plan reviews, and any other such meeting where the services to Columba Kavanagh tenants are discussed. The Supervisor shall have the responsibility to be certain that all meetings are recorded in the proper manner and those recordings distributed as appropriate.

The management of referrals for services to Columba Services. This shall include scheduling intake meetings, consulting with the Director of Residential Services, Intake Coordinator, and others regarding decisions on referral materials, and facilitating intake decisions as appropriate.

title: Instructor/Teacher STEAM Children's Enrichment
description:
Snapology is one of the best Children's Enrichment franchises in the country! You’ll love our core values and curriculum. Snapology’s approach is based on proven research that children’s best learning experiences come from actively creating, designing, interacting, and inventing. Please see our website seaford.snapology.com. Come join our team today!  

  

**Position:**  

The primary focus of an Instructor/Teacher STEAM Children's Enrichment will be to teach Snapology programs. Instructor/Teacher STEAM Children's Enrichment are asked to promote creativity, teamwork, and problem-solving skills while educating students on STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, & Math) concepts. Programs are conducted for children ages 2-14, although not all instructors are required to teach all age groups. This role requires internal collaboration and communication with Snapology leadership as well as representing the Snapology organization to parents & children with a high degree of professionalism. **We are a mobile business that operates in schools, libraries, homes, etc. throughout Nassau County Long Island.**
  

  

**Role & Responsibilities:**  

* Lead groups of up to 24 students through curriculum-guided activities
* Instruct and monitor students in the use of learning materials and equipment
* Manage student behavior in the classroom by establishing and enforcing rules and procedures
* Maintain discipline in accordance with the rules and disciplinary systems of Snapology
* Encourage and monitor the progress of individual students and use the information to adjust teaching strategies
* Adequately prepare for each program by reading curriculum, watching training videos, and/or participating in face-to-face training sessions
* Handle inquiries from parents regarding Snapology programs
* Encourage students & parents to enroll students in future Snapology programs
* Participate in periodic Snapology training & staff meetings, as required

**Qualifications:**  

* Criminal and Child Clearances must be current
* 2 or more years of experience working with children in a classroom or camp environment
* Education degree or teaching experience recommended, teachers, pursuing a degree in education will also be considered for this position
* Ability to establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with others
* Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
* Proven ability to report to work on a regular and punctual basis

**Programs:**  

* Weekday after-school and/or evening classes
* Weekend workshops and/or birthday parties
* Summer camps
* Special events, holiday and break workshops

  

*This position is part-time. Depending on candidate availability and the time of year, Instructor/Teacher STEAM Children's Enrichment typically work between 4-10 hours per week.*  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to Snapology Corporate.*
